case_vignette: A 14-year-old previously healthy male presents to your office with complaints of two months of dull, aching pain in his right leg that has recently become worse. While he experiences the pain constantly, he notes that it is sometimes so bad at night that it awakes him from his sleep. Though an avid soccer player, he has been unable to participate this season due to the pain and difficulty running. He cannot think of any particular trauma that might have precipitated this pain. Vitals are all within normal range. Physical examination reveals localized tenderness below the knee with mild swelling and reduced range of motion. You order an X-ray of the painful limb, which is shown in Figure A.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having this dull, aching pain in my right leg for two months now, and it's been getting worse lately.
How old are you?
I'm 14 years old.
Have you experienced any recent trauma or injury to your leg?
No, I can't think of any particular trauma or injury that might have caused the pain.
Do you have any other symptoms such as fever, weight loss, or night sweats?
No, I don't have any of those symptoms.
Does anyone in your family have a history of blood clotting disorders?
I'm not aware of any blood clotting disorders in my family.
Are you on any medications or have any medical conditions that might increase your risk of blood clots?
I'm not on any medications, and I don't have medical conditions that I know of.
**Final Diagnosis:** Possible deep vein thrombosis (DVT)
